{
  "results": {
    "row_AIID-00116": {
      "mitigation_text": [
        "Facebook disabled the artificial intelligence-powered feature that pushed the 'primates' recommendation prompt.",
        "Facebook announced it was investigating the recommendation feature to prevent this from happening again.",
        "Facebook apologized for what it called 'an unacceptable error.'",
        "A product manager for Facebook Watch called the prompt 'unacceptable.'",
        "A product manager for Facebook Watch said the company was looking into the root cause of the prompt.",
        "Darci Groves posted a screenshot of the prompt to a product feedback forum for current and former Facebook employees."
      ],
      "assigned_subcategories": [
        "System & Feature Restrictions",
        "Incident Investigation",
        "Incident Reporting"
      ]
    },
    "row_AIID-00117": {
      "mitigation_text": [
        "Facebook agreed to pay $550 million to settle a class-action lawsuit regarding its use of facial recognition technology.",
        "The $550 million settlement will be paid out to eligible Illinois users.",
        "The $550 million settlement will cover the plaintiffs' legal fees.",
        "Facebook disclosed the settlement as part of its fourth-quarter earnings report.",
        "In 2018, Facebook began more transparently explaining its facial recognition technology to users.",
        "Facebook pointed users to a settings page where they could disable facial recognition.",
        "The company decided to make facial recognition on the platform opt-in only.",
        "Facebook appealed the class-action certification ruling."
      ],
      "assigned_subcategories": [
        "Financial, Economic & Compensation Remedies",
        "Data Governance",
        "User Rights & Recourse",
        "Governance Disclosure",
        "Court & Law Enforcement Interventions"
      ]
    },
    "row_AIID-00118": {
      "mitigation_text": [
        "Google stated it has been working on accurately recognizing variations of speech for several years and will continue to do so.",
        "IBM stated it continues to develop, improve, and advance its natural language and speech processing capabilities to bring increasing levels of functionality to business users via IBM Watson.",
        "The Stanford researchers urged makers of speech recognition systems to collect better data on African American Vernacular English and other varieties of English, including regional accents."
      ],
      "assigned_subcategories": [
        "Data Governance"
      ]
    },
    "row_AIID-00119": {
      "mitigation_text": [
        "OpenAI released GPT-3 only to a restricted group of vetted developers and companies.",
        "OpenAI required those vetted developers and companies to minimize potential social harms caused by their applications.",
        "OpenAI established an academic access program allowing scholars to request access to probe GPT-3 for bias.",
        "Abid and his co-authors reduced biased outputs by front-loading the 'Two Muslims walked into a …' prompt with a short positive phrase.",
        "OpenAI researchers fine-tuned GPT-3 by giving it an extra round of training on a smaller, more curated dataset.",
        "Researchers supplied the original GPT-3 with 80 well-crafted question-and-answer text samples to change its behavior.",
        "OpenAI researchers are continuing to experiment with fine-tuning approaches to reduce bias.",
        "Another team is attempting to improve the initial training dataset to make it less biased."
      ],
      "assigned_subcategories": [
        "Staged Deployment",
        "Access Management",
        "Testing & Auditing",
        "Model Safety Engineering",
        "Data Governance"
      ]
    },
    "row_AIID-00120": {
      "mitigation_text": [
        "ProctorU employs human proctors who make final decisions on student identity and verify exam integrity.",
        "ProctorU uses a diverse group of trained human proctors assisted by technology to safeguard exam integrity and assist students.",
        "The University of Toronto has vetted and approved ProctorU's systems and protocols for remote test proctoring.",
        "The University of Toronto continuously monitors issues that arise around e-proctoring.",
        "The University administration issued guidance that e-proctoring should not be the first or only way divisions seek to ensure academic integrity on assessments.",
        "Any issues flagged by the e-proctoring system are reviewed in the first instance by instructors.",
        "The University of Toronto offers anti-racism and unconscious bias training to all members of its community.",
        "The Centre for Teaching Support & Innovation advised that online proctoring should be considered only for unique situations or needs given the additional logistical challenges and potential equity issues.",
        "Six Democratic U.S. Senators wrote an open letter highlighting issues of privacy, accessibility, and equity with exam monitoring services."
      ],
      "assigned_subcategories": [
        "Post-Deployment Monitoring",
        "Third-Party System Access",
        "Training & Supportive Measures",
        "Incident Response & Recovery",
        "Usage & Access Limitations"
      ]
    }
  }
}

{
  "results": {
    "row_AIID-00126": {
      "mitigation_text": [
        "Amazon committed over $1 billion in new investments in operations safety measures.",
        "Amazon distributed masks to employees.",
        "Amazon distributed gloves to employees.",
        "Amazon implemented enhanced cleaning and sanitization to protect employees from COVID-19.",
        "Amazon installed guardrails to separate forklifts from pedestrians.",
        "Amazon increased safety staffing.",
        "Amazon offered wellness exercises to employees.",
        "Amazon invested in safety training and education programs.",
        "Amazon invested in safety technology and new safety infrastructure.",
        "Amazon's environment, health and safety team sent monthly detailed updates marked 'Privileged & Confidential' to warehouse safety managers with data, charts and FAQs.",
        "Amazon set safety goals and monitored progress closely.",
        "Amazon piloted rotating workers to different jobs to alleviate repetitive stress.",
        "Half of the pilot sites turned off sort rotation during Prime Week.",
        "Amazon piloted blocking off the highest and lowest shelves on warehouse racks to optimize work allocation to associates' power zones.",
        "Five of six warehouses testing the shelf-blocking pilot put the program on hold for the runup to Prime Day.",
        "Amazon's safety team rolled out an initiative called 'temporary light duty' to reduce lost-time injuries by reassigning injured workers.",
        "Amazon reassigned injured workers to tag photos on a computer to help train the company's machine learning algorithms as part of temporary light duty.",
        "Amazon loaned injured workers to nonprofit organizations as part of temporary light-duty assignments.",
        "Amazon terminated the use of an occupational clinic with poor performance for its Thornton, Colorado warehouse.",
        "Amazon contracted with Advanced Urgent Care & Occupational Medicine as a new clinic for injured Colorado workers.",
        "Amazon sought to ensure stronger use of its on-site AmCare first aid clinic and to reduce the probability of associates transitioning to external clinic care.",
        "Advanced Urgent Care & Occupational Medicine's medical director instructed clinic staff to contact her or the clinic owner before giving restrictions or making Amazon cases OSHA-recordable.",
        "The owner of Advanced Urgent Care & Occupational Medicine decided to stop providing occupational medical care for companies, including Amazon, at the end of the year.",
        "Amazon's vice president of public policy wrote to U.S. senators asserting the company changed its approach to recordkeeping in 2016 to report all injuries.",
        "Amazon's senior vice president for global corporate affairs went on CNBC to publicly defend the company's reporting and policies.",
        "A group of 15 U.S. senators sent a letter to Jeff Bezos demanding a list of changes in Amazon's warehouses.",
        "OSHA issued a hazard alert letter against an Amazon robotic warehouse in New Jersey and recommended measures such as an extra rest break and rotating employees to different jobs.",
        "OSHA fined Amazon $7,000 for failing to record more than two dozen injuries as required.",
        "Amazon invested $800 million on COVID-19 safety measures in the first half of the year.",
        "Amazon fired a worker who helped organize a walkout at its Staten Island fulfillment center.",
        "Amazon fired two tech employees who spoke up in support of the Staten Island worker.",
        "Amazon provided talking points to safety managers to pass along to workers during peak times."
      ],
      "assigned_subcategories": [
        "Risk Management",
        "Training & Supportive Measures",
        "Incident Response & Recovery",
        "System Documentation",
        "Incident Reporting"
      ]
    },
    "row_AIID-00127": {
      "mitigation_text": [
        "The University of Illinois announced it will discontinue use of Proctorio and that the software will be discontinued in mid-2021.",
        "More than 1,000 students and teachers signed a petition asking the University of Illinois to discontinue Proctorio.",
        "A university in Miami discontinued its remote-testing software after a petition with more than 500 signatures was passed.",
        "The University of Regina announced it will discontinue ProctorTrack after a petition with 3,500 signatures was passed.",
        "The University of Central Florida announced it will discontinue Honorlock after a petition with 1,200 signatures was passed.",
        "Proctorio denied that the software discriminates and stated that lighting, webcam position, and webcam quality are the reasons it may not work properly.",
        "Activists have launched movements to ban remote-testing software."
      ],
      "assigned_subcategories": [
        "System & Feature Restrictions",
        "Market Access & Commercial Restrictions"
      ]
    },
    "row_AIID-00128": {
      "mitigation_text": [
        "TikTok banned six accounts reported for posting content promoting eating habits that are likely to lead to health problems.",
        "TikTok said users searching for eating disorder-related content will be redirected to the National Eating Disorder Association (NEDA) helpline.",
        "TikTok said it would prohibit ads promoting fasting apps and weight loss gimmicks to users under 18.",
        "The platform banned content labeled #proana and #anorexia.",
        "Users who searched for the #proana and #anorexia hashtags were redirected to a support page titled \"Need Help?\"",
        "Pinterest trained its algorithm to recognize content that promotes self-harm, which the company reported reduced those pins by 88%.",
        "When users specifically search for the remaining Pins, Pinterest recommends a series of wellbeing exercises."
      ],
      "assigned_subcategories": [
        "Content Safety Controls",
        "Model Safety Engineering",
        "System & Feature Restrictions",
        "Training & Supportive Measures"
      ]
    },
    "row_AIID-00129": {
      "mitigation_text": [
        "TikTok provided a public statement to BuzzFeed asserting that its recommendation algorithm is based on user behavior via collaborative filtering and not on race or the account's picture.",
        "In December, TikTok admitted that it had been burying content made by queer, fat, and disabled users."
      ],
      "assigned_subcategories": [
        "Governance Disclosure",
        "Incident Reporting"
      ]
    },
    "row_AIID-00130": {
      "mitigation_text": [
        "Facebook decreased the reach of suspect content on its platform.",
        "Facebook removed some, though not all, of the barriers users faced when filing reports.",
        "Facebook intentionally made it harder for users to file reports two years ago.",
        "Facebook tweaked its algorithm in a way that led it to ignore more user reports.",
        "Facebook proactively removed 15 times more hate speech in 2020 than in 2017.",
        "Facebook's engineers shifted model training to prioritize avoiding false positives.",
        "Facebook set a goal to reduce the dollar cost of total hate review capacity by 15%."
      ],
      "assigned_subcategories": [
        "Content Safety Controls",
        "Model Safety Engineering",
        "System & Feature Restrictions",
        "Incident Reporting",
        "Risk Management"
      ]
    }
  }
}

        "Ocado released a statement disclosing that a fire had erupted at its Erith Customer Fulfillment Centre.",
        "Ocado evacuated over 800 employees from the facility.",
        "Ocado contained the damage to less than 1 percent of the grid using its fire attenuation measures.",

        "Microsoft's internal ethics board prompted the company to refuse business from some corporate customers.",
        "Microsoft's internal ethics board prompted the company to attach conditions to some deals limiting the use of its technology.",
        "Microsoft's internal ethics board trained Microsoft sales teams on applications of AI the company is wary of.",
        "Microsoft helped improve a cloud service for analyzing faces after a research paper revealed it was much less accurate for black women than white men.",

        "Fairness Flow's feedback helped Facebook engineers choose job recommendation algorithms that worked better for different kinds of people.",
        "Facebook is working on building Fairness Flow and similar tools into the machine-learning platform used company-wide.",

        "Google welcomed feedback on Duplex as it is refined into a product.",
        "Google engaged in a broad internal discussion about military uses of machine learning.",
        "Google is working on a set of principles that will guide the use of its technology.",
        "Google's photo-organizing service was reprogrammed not to tag photos with \"monkey\" or \"chimp\" after a 2015 incident in which images of black people were tagged \"gorilla.\"",
        "Axon announced an ethics board of external experts to review ideas such as using AI in policing products like body cameras.",
        "Axon's ethics board will meet quarterly.",
        "Axon's ethics board will publish one or more reports a year.",
        "Axon's ethics board includes a member designated as a point of contact for Axon employees concerned about specific work.",
        "Axon said it was looking at having the board take input from a wider range of people.",
        "Tesla collects and analyzes safety and crash data from its vehicles.",
        "Tesla owners can use voice commands to provide additional feedback to the company."

    },
    "row_AIID-00169": {
      "mitigation_text": [

        "The court ordered METRO to immediately suspend the roll-out of new equipment that enables data capture and biometric processing for facial recognition.",
        "The court's decision imposes a daily fine for non-compliance with the suspension order.",
        "METRO said it will appeal the decision and provide clarifications regarding the monitoring system's compliance with data protection regulations."

      "assigned_subcategories": [

    "row_AIID-00170": {
      "mitigation_text": [
        "The U.S. Department of Education opened an investigation in April into the data-sharing arrangement between Pasco County Schools and the Pasco Sheriff’s Office.",
        "In early May the Pasco Sheriff’s Office and the school board revised their data-sharing agreement so school resource officers would no longer have access to student grades.",
        "In early May the Pasco Sheriff’s Office and the school board revised their data-sharing agreement so school resource officers would no longer have access to student discipline histories.",
        "In early May the Pasco Sheriff’s Office and the school board revised their data-sharing agreement so school resource officers would no longer have access to the school district’s early warning system.",
        "The Pasco Sheriff’s Office released a lengthy public statement responding to reporting on the program.",
        "A coalition of 30 advocacy groups called the PASCO Coalition issued a statement calling for the immediate termination of the student data-sharing arrangement.",
        "The St. Paul collaborative program to develop a triage referral system and share data was halted in less than a year.",
        "The American Civil Liberties Union sued Riverside County over its voluntary probation program.",
        "After being sued by the ACLU, Riverside County stopped using the voluntary probation program that designated young people as at risk.",
        "The Tampa Bay Times disclosed the existence of the Pasco County intelligence-led policing program in late 2020."
      ],
      "assigned_subcategories": [

        "Access Management",
        "Incident Investigation",
        "System & Feature Restrictions",
        "Incident Reporting"

    "row_AIID-00637": {
      "mitigation_text": [
        "PTI posted on X from the party's official account that the audio was fake and alleged controlled media were running fake news about PTI boycotting the elections.",
        "PTI leader Zulfi Bukhari told Logically Facts that the audio was fabricated and dismissed any notion of a boycott.",
        "Independent experts consulted by Logically Facts confirmed with a high degree of certainty that the audio was artificially generated and did not originate from Imran Khan.",
        "Audio forensics expert Tanmay Srivastava noted the presence of an unnatural white noise throughout the recording that was likely added in post-production.",
        "Tanmay Srivastava observed that the intonation of the voice in the clip was monotone with no natural variation in pitch or tone.",
        "Tanmay Srivastava stated that sibilant consonants in the clip sounded mechanical or highly processed rather than natural.",
        "Tanmay Srivastava highlighted specific timestamps (including 0:38-0:39, 0:02-0:03, 0:28-0:29, 1:15-1:17, and 1:03-1:05) where the audio appeared heavily edited or had unnatural noises added.",
        "Experts from IIT Jodhpur led by Professor Mayank Vatsa used four distinct deep-learning models to evaluate the audio's authenticity.",
        "The IIT Jodhpur team shared their high-confidence model findings with Logically Facts.",
        "PTI officials actively countered deepfake narratives by clarifying the authenticity of videos and audio clips attributed to them.",
        "PTI leader Muhammad Basharat Raja posted on X that a video claiming he would boycott the elections was an AI-generated deepfake.",
        "Muhammad Basharat Raja stated that he would be standing in the current election.",
        "The Information Secretary of PTI London flagged another digitally altered video of a PTI leader purportedly announcing a boycott."
      ],
      "assigned_subcategories": [
        "Incident Investigation",
        "Testing & Auditing",
        "Risk Disclosure"
      ]
    }
  }
}

      "mitigation_text": [
        "She posted a clarification on her real Twitter account stating the tweets were fake and warning people not to fall for them.",
        "She deleted her Facebook account.",
        "She sought medical treatment at a hospital where a doctor prescribed medication for her anxiety and heart palpitations.",
        "Her brother flew in from Mumbai to see her.",
        "She contacted and retained a high-profile feminist lawyer who agreed to take on her case.",
        "She and her lawyer went to a police station to file a complaint about the video.",
        "She threatened the police that she would write about them on social media if they did not register her complaint.",
        "Her lawyer told the police they would go to the media if the complaint was not registered.",
        "The police eventually filed a report about the incident.",
        "She gave her statement to a magistrate and provided screenshots and the messages she had received as evidence.",
        "Sixteen United Nations special rapporteurs wrote to the Indian government asking it to protect her.",
        "She stopped posting on Facebook and began self-censoring her online activity."
